required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Human Amniotic Membrane to Decrease Post Operative Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Feasibility Human Amniotic Membrane to Decrease Post Operative Atrial Fibrillation After Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the application of hAM at the time of cardiac surgery to decrease inflammation and the subsequent substrate to reduce incidence of post-operative atrial fibrillation. Patients will randomized 1:1 to receive either hAM application or standard of care.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessment of the use of human amniotic membrane during cardiac surgery by incidence of adverse events
primary_outcome.description: The AM applied epicardially will be assessed for signs of hyperacute rejection i.e. membrane changing color; cardiac tamponade or constriction assessed by echocardiogram and transmission of infectious diseases. The incidence of adverse events (AEs) will be reported as percentages, with two-sided 95% confidence intervals. Statistical comparisons of AEs between the AM treatment and the control group will be made using a chi-square, or Fisher's exact test, as appropriate (based on the minimum expected cell frequencies).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the incidence of Post Op Atrial Fibrillation between patients who receive hAM and controls
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of Post Op Atrial Fibrillation will be compared between the treatment and control group using mobile telemetry. This comparison will be analyzed using chi-square or Fisher's exact test as appropriate.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of inflammatory response (systemic and pericardial) between patients who received hAM and controls
primary_outcome.description: The proinflammatory response to cardiopulmonary bypass circuit as measured by numerous systemic and pericardial inflammatory markers i.e. C-reactive protein (CRP), TNF-Î±, Interleukin (IL)-6 and brain natriuretic peptide (BNP), have been linked to induction of atrial fibrillation. We will collect pericardial (from chest tubes) and systemic fluid markers at pre-specified intervals. We will assess the percentage change in the levels of the biomarkers as compared to their pre-operative baseline, as there will be expected variability in the level of these biomarkers at baseline.

intervention.description: Epicardial application of human amniotic membrane during cardiac surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing primary elective CABG at the University of Utah Hospital
- Ability to provided informed consent and follow-up with protocol procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients in AF at the time of surgery
- Prior history of sternotomy
- Prior history of pericarditis
- Currently on aggressive antiarrhythmic therapy (does not include beta blockers)
- Patients with an implantable cardiac device (pacemaker, ICD, CRT-D)
- Ejection fraction <45%
